description: This feature includes registering and approval of Business User
name: Business User Creation

elements.name: To verify that valid System admin/Business Admin is able to initiate businsess user creation for O2C

steps.name: Login into Mobiquity Portal as System admin Maker
Navigate to User Management and Click on register
Select User type as Business and Select user role
Enter all the required business user details for O2C
Confirmation message is displayed
Navigate to My Activity and Aplly required filters
Assert Created Buissness User Mobile Number and Write Created on time for O2C

elements.name: To verify approval business user created for o2c

steps.name: Login into Mobiquity Portal as System admin Checker1
Navigate to Approvals and filter by Submitted status
User click on Buissness User submitted user data for O2C
Approve the Users
User status is approved

elements.name: To verify that valid System admin/Business Admin is able to initiate businsess user creation.

steps.name: Login into Mobiquity Portal as System admin Maker
Navigate to User Management and Click on register
Select User type as Business and Select user role
Enter all the required business user details
Confirmation message is displayed
Navigate to My Activity and Aplly required filters
Assert Created Buissness User Mobile Number and Write Created on time

elements.name: To verify that another System Admin/businsess User  is able to approve the initiated business user creation.

steps.name: Login into Mobiquity Portal as System admin Checker1
Navigate to Approvals and filter by Submitted status
User click on Buisness User submitted user data
Approve the Users
User status is approved

elements.name: To verify that Business admin is able to  view Self details

steps.name: Login into Mobiquity Portal as Business admin User1

`<input class="form-input" type="password" placeholder="Enter new password" name="newPassword">`

Cypress requires elements be attached in the DOM to interact with them.

The previous command that ran was:

  > `cy.eq()`

This DOM element likely became detached somewhere between the previous and current command.

Common situations why this happens:
  - Your JS framework re-rendered asynchronously
  - Your app code reacted to an event firing and removed the element

You typically need to re-query for the element or add 'guards' which delay Cypress from running new commands.
